Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client
  • class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of a Java Singleton Design Pattern for optimal client performance in containerized environments. It combines "Bill Pugh initialization on demand" and "thread safe volatile double check locking" principles. To avoid an anti-pattern, this class should not be used in reflection, serialization, or cloning.

    • Field Detail

      • instance

        static volatile Client instance
        volatile to denote a "happens-before relationship". i.e. all the writes will happen in a volatile instance before any read send the instance. more: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9328252/why-can-an-object-member-variable-not-be-both-final-and-volatile-in-java

        com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 s3

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static Client getInstance()
        The static function responsible for safely returning the desired object.
        Returns:
        a lazy initialized and volatile Client instance

      • unmarshalEmail

        Email unmarshalEmail​(java.lang.String json)
        Decodes the argument into an Email object.
        Parameters:
        json - String value representing the request body
        Returns:
        Email object, or null if json is improperly formatted.

      • getHtml

        java.lang.String getHtml​(java.lang.String bucket,
                         java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves a potential html email template using the local s3 client.
        Parameters:
        bucket - String value of the S3 bucket name containing html email templates
        key - String value of the S3 bucket key for an html email template
        Returns:
        String value of an html email template, or blank if no template found.

      • sendEmail

        void sendEmail​(java.lang.String from,
               java.lang.String to,
               java.lang.String subject,
               java.lang.String html)
        Sends an email using the local ses client.
        Parameters:
        from - String value of email sender
        to - String value of email recipient
        subject - String value of email subject
        html - String value of email body (raw)
